title: Can't access stored emails in new installation
content: I reinstalled Thunderbird (Fedora RPM) but now the Local Folder Browse window won't let me select where I store my email (documents/email/(account name)) and profiles from the old installation. When I try to point to the folder where they were stored in the old installation, it says the folder is 'not suitable for message storage'. The result is that I can't access any of my old emails (pop account). They exist, but are inaccessable. These are important business emails and it will seriously impact me if I can get them back. I'd appreciate your ideas on how to bring the old emails on the previous folder into the new installation. Thanks.
creator: bill123

title: Creating folder
content: I'm on 141.0 (64 bit). I'm trying to create a mail folder (right click on "Local Folders", "New Folder"option). As I type the name, when I exceed eight positions the "Create Folder" tab goes dark. In other words, you can't create a folder with a name longer than eight positions. This is new.
creator: tcluster

title: Corrupt emails show as plain text only
content:
With 140.1.1esr 32-bit (on a 64-bit laptop) I'm getting some emails from Earthlink POP3 account corrupted and showing only as plain text. The bad emails all share these 2 lines which do not appear in other good emails:

Received-SPF: pas .

I have another laptop with 140.1.0esr 64-bit and it does not have any problems with Earthlink POP3 emails.

When I installed 140.1.0esr 64-bit on the "bad" laptop, the problem goes away.

I was also getting corrupted emails from a Gmail POP account but could not see what might be missing or bad in the source.

Just an observation, this suddenly started happening on Aug 11.

Here's a post about maybe the same problem: https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/answers/questions/5520490/suddenly-most-of-my-e-mails-contain-unintelligble
creator: fannydog18

title: SMTP Not Working
content:
Recently, I tried to set up a new account with an email address like this: webmaster@mywebsite.com. My intent, when I get this right, is to use it to receive email generated by users of my website or sent to it by non-users who might discover the address.

Apparently I hosed something up, because now I can't sent email. In response to clicking the Send button, I get a response like the that in the screenshot after a few seconds.

I've checked my settings, also in a screenshot.

I deleted the new email account but I still get errors. I've slept more than twice; so I don't remember if I even made any changes to SMTP other than to specify the Google SMTP server for the account I set up.

What am I doing wrong? What do I need to do to fix this?
creator: rabbithutch1

title: email filters
content: What has happened to Thunderbird - the 'create filter from message' option is no longer available, filters already set don't seem to be working, and I can't find the settings to run the filters. Please help - I'm missing important emails. Kristin MOore

title: Missing emails
content:
Thunderbird version: 140.1.1esr (aarch64) MacOS 15.6

After the most recent Thunderbird update, I noticed that one of my local folders was completely empty. When I do a search for an email that was in that folder, the email shows as a search result, but when I click on the search result, it opens a new tab and says 'no message found' - although a preview of the email is visible in the search results.

I have tried restoring a backup of the local folders from my Time Machine backup, and while restoring those files did wind back all the other local folders and emails, it did not restore any emails into the problematic folder, even going back to my oldest time machine backup on the 26th of May this year - when I know the emails were still accessible - didn't help.

It's clear that the emails are still there, in some form, since the search function can sort of find them, however there is an issue retrieving and viewing them.

I am hoping someone can help! Thank you in advance, Claire.
creator: turvey.au

title: Version 140.1.1 esr messages via pop no longer correctly processed
content: A new version of thunderbird (140.1.1 esr) installed itself yesterday, and since then the incoming messages from an account configured with pop are no longer correctly displayed. ie the headers are not interpreted, and the body is displayed as text, even when the option "body of message" says "original html" or "simple html". (sorry if the terms are inexact, my version of TB speaks french) Is there a way to fix this, or should I now use IMAP on this account ? (basically I used pop so that messages get deleted from the server after one month and kept locally in order not to get over quota stuff from the server).

title: Ik heb dubbele mappen in accounts
content:
Hallo, Ik weet niet of ik bij "settings" goed zit. Ik heb bij meerdere accounts dubbele systeem mappen: https://assets-prod.sumo.prod.webservices.mozgcp.net/media/uploads/images/2025-08-13-02-32-48-b1db84.png

Als ik de mappen ongewenst wil verwijderen zie ik dat de een de "Junk" en de andere de "Spam" map is. Bij de twee Archieven lukt dit trucje niet. Daar staat verwijderen niet in het pop-up lijstje. Dus een eventuele andere benaming is dan ook niet te vinden.

Ik denk dat het bij ongewenst aan de vertaling ligt. Bij archieven vond ik Archive.mfs en Archives.mfs Zou dat ook aan de vertaling: Archief en Archieven kunnen zijn?

Als het aan de vertaling ligt dan zou die bij Ongewenst aanpassen. Bij archief weet ik het niet.
creator: AKostenzer

title: Unified Folders
content:
Not sure if this is the correct subject heading.

Thunderbird 140.1.1esr for Windows 11 - no add-ons I have 4 email accounts (2 with Google). For some time I have been having trouble with Unified Folders. From the Folders pane on the left of the screen, - the Inbox and Deleted folders appear to be working as intended, if I expand either folder, it correctly displays the 4 accounts, and if I click on either folder, it correctly displays the messages for all 4 accounts - the Sent folder also appears to be working to an extent, if I expand the Sent folder, it displays the 4 accounts plus a duplicate of one of the Google accounts. If I click on Sent, it correctly displays the sent messages for all 4 accounts - the Drafts and Junk folders are both problematic - if I expand the Drafts folder, it displays only 1 of the 4 accounts plus a duplicate of the 1 account. If I click on Drafts, it correctly displays the draft messages for all 4 accounts - if I expand the Junk folder, it displays only 3 of the 4 accounts with 1 of the Google accounts missing, plus a duplicate of one of the non-Google accounts. If I click on Junk, it displays No Messages Found even though I know there are messages to be found My problem is the inconsistent way it treats the Sent, Drafts and Junk folders. I can't rely on them to drill down into individual accounts. If I need to do that I have to go online to webmail, which kind of defeats the object of using Thunderbird. If I disable Unified Folders and use All Folders everything is fine. Is there any way to get the unified folders to behave as one would expect? PS I've tried deleting smartmailboxes but this didn't help.
creator: rwillia211

title: Thunderbird Password Problem
content:
I live in Germany and use Deutsche Telekom's T-Online system for my main e-mail system, so my email address is: k.vanleuven@t-online.de

Due to some security problem, I had the change my T-Online e-mail password and since this time I can't send or receive e-mails from my German version of Thunderbird. Thunderbird asks me for the"secureimap.t-online.de" server password, but it doesn't recognize the new password that I have for my T-Online e-mail system.

I store my e-mails in various folders folders in Thunderbird and I want to continue using Thunderbird for my e-mail management.

I think I might have to re-install Thunderbird from scratch. Must I do this, if so haw do I save all my e-maile files?

Your help in solving this problem will be very much appreciated.

Karl Van Leuven
creator: k.vanleuven

title: Getting the Best Help from the Thunderbird Community
content:
When seeking help in communities like Thunderbird Support, it’s important to remember that kindness and clear communication go a long way. Volunteers dedicate their time to assist, so being descriptive—like saying “videos on YouTube are choppy”—helps them understand your issue much faster than vague statements.

In the same way, surah waqia reminds us about the power of clarity, truth, and patience in all matters. Just as we should describe our problems clearly to get the right help, we should also reflect on our own actions and words, making them purposeful and meaningful. Both in tech support and in life, clear intentions lead to better outcomes.
creator: hussainnkg64

title: Email send problem with Comcast account
content:
I can no longer send emails using my Comcast account. This problem just started. I periodically get this error message:

thunderbird authentication failure while connecting to server imap.comcast.net

I am using a Windows 10 desktop PC. - I have no problem sending emails using my gmail account on this PC. - I have no problem sending emails using the Comcast account on a second Windows 10 desktop PC and using my Android app. - I can receive email from the Comcast account on the problem PC. - The server settings on the problem PC are the same as on the PC that is able to send messages on the Comcast account. - I tried reinstalling Thunderbird on the problem PC. - I changed Authentication Method from "OAuth2" to "Normal Password".

Any suggestions?
creator: DonK

title: Thunderbird can't handle the mails from my webmail any longer - they turn up garbled and all are called "spam"
content:
Hello, Some time during the weekend my Thunderbird could no longer properly receive and handle my webmail. I tried to repair/reinstall my version of Thunderbird (60.0. with file version 60.1.1.6781). When that didn't help, I tried the latest version instead (115 I believe) but that didn't fix the issue. I then turned to other mail programs like for example Mailbird, but although I tried their latest version, the problem persisted. I do get the mails from my webmail, but when entering the mail program they lose their names and are only called SPAM - all of them. They turn up in a garbled version, which I believe is the source code of the mail in question. Here and there in the text I can see an email address, which lets me know who sent it. But that's all.

However, there is one mail program, which still can handle my webmail, and that is Microsoft Outlook! That suggests to me that there has been some sort of Microsoft general update/change, which has gone into active mode over the weekend, resulting in that only Microsoft's own mail program can handle the mail.

Is there anyone out there which has experienced the same or knows the remedy for this, I would be infinitely grateful for help.

I add a list my own computer's hardware specs if that is of any help.

Thanks in advance! Kind Regards Ann-Charlotte Thomson
creator: sailor1947

title: Inserimento (non voluto) di trattini all'inizio di un nuovo messaggio
content:
Buongiorno, sto usando la versione 141.0 di Thunderbird 64 bit e ho notato la seguente anomalia. Quando creo un nuovo messaggio di posta usando il bottone "+ Nuovo messaggio" all'inizio del messaggio vengono inseriti una riga vuota e una riga con due trattini. Sto utilizzando la firma letta da un file html; lo stesso file viene visualizzato correttamente (quindi senza riga nè trattini) se aperto con Firefox. La cosa strana è che facendo rispondi o inoltra di una mail esistente i trattini e la riga vuota non vengono inseriti. Allego qualche immagine che spiega meglio la situazione. Ho chiesto a un collega e la stessa anomalia capita anche a lui. Potete aiutarmi? Grazie.

Cordiali saluti Marco
creator: marco.ferri1
